population_specificity: Prostate cancer (PCa) patients and preclinical models (in vitro and in vivo).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the advantages and recent progress of chitosan nanoparticles in brain drug delivery, focusing on their biocompatibility, drug encapsulation, and targeting properties.
results_summary: Chitosan nanoparticles demonstrated advantages in protecting drugs from enzyme degradation, controlled release, improved bioavailability, and enhanced permeability across the blood-brain barrier. Surface modifications with tumor-targeting peptides further improved their targeting efficacy for brain tumors.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article, not a clinical study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of a chitosan-based biocompatible dressing for treating cutaneous leishmaniasis in patients nonresponsive to or contraindicated for conventional treatments.
results_summary: All patients showed significant (30%) or complete (70%) improvement after 8 weeks, with full recovery by 16 weeks post-treatment. No adverse events, allergic reactions, or infections were reported, and no recurrences occurred after 6 months.
population_specificity: 10 patients with cutaneous leishmaniasis nonresponsive to or contraindicated for conventional treatments.
effective_dosage: Sterile chitosan film applied weekly for 7 days until healing.
study_duration: Up to 16 weeks (with follow-up at 6 months).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of Chitosan nanopolymers (ChNPs) as a target-specific drug delivery system for cancer treatment and diagnosis.
results_summary: The abstract highlights ChNPs' biodegradability, biocompatibility, and versatility in loading various therapeutic agents for cancer therapy, suggesting their promise in improving treatment effectiveness and reducing side effects. However, specific efficacy data or clinical outcomes are not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the synthesis and applications of chitosan-based Schiff bases (CSBs) in fields like biology, catalysis, and water treatment.
results_summary: The study found that CSBs, synthesized via Schiff condensation, exhibit significant biological applications including antimicrobial, anticancer, and antioxidant activities, as well as utility in drug delivery and tissue engineering. CSBs also show promise in catalysis, adsorption, and sensor technologies.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the progress and potential of chitosan-based hydrogels as delivery systems for therapeutic applications, including gene therapy and chemotherapy.
results_summary: The study highlights chitosan's biodegradability, non-toxicity, and versatility in forming smart hydrogels responsive to environmental stimuli, but notes limitations in physical and chemical properties for in vivo disease therapy.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent developments in chitosan oligosaccharide (COS) biomedical applications, focusing on its physicochemical properties, chemical composition, and pharmacokinetic aspects, including safety concerns.
results_summary: The study found that COS exhibits significant biological properties such as antimicrobial, antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and antihypertensive effects, as well as potential applications in drug/DNA delivery, antidiabetic, anti-obesity, and anti-HIV-1 effects. It also highlighted COS's higher cellular transduction and intestinal absorption due to its cationic properties.
population_specificity: Not specified (broad biomedical, pharmaceutical, and agricultural applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the anti-inflammatory effects of polysaccharide-based tablets, including chitosan, on IBD in rats when used as drug carriers targeted to the colon.
results_summary: Chitosan demonstrated superior anti-inflammatory effects compared to pectin in IBD treatment, reducing ulcer scores, ulcer area, and inflammatory markers like TNFα and iNOS while increasing antioxidant levels (GSH, SOD). Polysaccharide-based matrix systems were more effective than coated systems.
population_specificity: TNBS-induced IBD Wistar rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate chitosan as a carrier for curcumin to enhance its aqueous solubility and oral bioavailability.
results_summary: The study reviewed various methods for chitosan-based delivery of curcumin, suggesting that chitosan can improve the solubility and bioavailability of hydrophobic drugs like curcumin. However, specific efficacy data or clinical outcomes were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Not specified (review study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent developments in chitosan-based nanoformulations for ovarian cancer therapy, focusing on modifications and targeting strategies.
results_summary: Chitosan-based nanoparticles show promise as nanocarriers for delivering therapeutic agents to ovarian cancer cells due to their biodegradability and bio-distribution. The study highlights chitosan's potential for both passive and active tumor targeting through covalent and non-covalent modifications.
population_specificity: Ovarian cancer cell lines (in vitro or preclinical focus).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the biomedical applications of chitosan, focusing on its suitability as a biomaterial for wound management, drug delivery, tissue engineering, and nanotechnology.
results_summary: Chitosan demonstrated a wide variety of successful biomedical applications, including fabrication as wound dressings, scaffolds, and drug delivery systems. It showed promise for delivering small molecule drugs, proteins, and genes at the nano-scale.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing literature).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of a chitosan brush for treating peri-implant mucositis compared to titanium curettes.
results_summary: The chitosan brush showed better improvement in bleeding on probing (mBoP) at 2 and 4 weeks and a significantly greater reduction in probing pocket depths (PPD) at 4 weeks compared to titanium curettes. Both groups exhibited reduced inflammation by 6 months, with stable bone levels observed radiographically.
population_specificity: 11 patients with 24 dental implants diagnosed with peri-implant mucositis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review biodegradable nanocarrier strategies, including chitosan, for treating periodontitis, focusing on improving drug delivery and therapeutic outcomes.
results_summary: The abstract suggests chitosan-based nanocarriers could enhance drug loading and release, potentially aiding microbiological control, periodontal regeneration, and immunomodulation, but does not provide specific efficacy data.
population_specificity: Patients with periodontitis (general mention, no specific demographic details).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of combining chitosan and graphene as a drug delivery system, focusing on its advantages, forms, and applications.
results_summary: The study highlights that combining chitosan with graphene improves mechanical properties, addressing burst release issues in chitosan-based carriers, but notes inconsistencies in existing research that require further review.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if a chitosan-based hemostatic pad (Clo-Sur) could reduce time to hemostasis compared to mechanical compression alone following transradial arterial access (TRA) in cardiac catheterization patients.
results_summary: The study found that using the chitosan-based pad significantly reduced median time to hemostasis (30-60 min) compared to mechanical compression alone (120.5 min). No differences in patient characteristics or heparin dosing were observed among cohorts.
population_specificity: 40 patients undergoing cardiac catheterization and/or percutaneous coronary intervention.
effective_dosage: Not specified (application duration varied: 30, 45, or 60 min).
study_duration: Hemostasis time was measured post-intervention (30-120 min).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to classify chemical fusogens, including chitosan, based on their mechanisms of action (cell aggregators or membrane modifiers) and hypothesize their potential role in axonal membrane repair.
results_summary: Chitosan was identified as one of seven chemical fusogens capable of facilitating cell fusion, either by bringing cells into close proximity or modifying membrane surface charges. The study suggested that combining both mechanisms could enhance axonal membrane repair.
population_specificity: Not specified (study involved a literature review of fusogens in protoplasts, animals, and humans).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and characterize vaginal films containing chitosan and hydroxypropyl methylcellulose with tioconazole to improve treatment for vaginal candidiasis.
results_summary: Films with chitosan-hydroxypropyl methylcellulose and 40% PEG 400 showed fast antimicrobial activity, low swelling, and minimal cytotoxicity, making them a promising alternative for treating Candida albicans infections. However, films based solely on chitosan exhibited some cytotoxicity and should be avoided.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro and ex vivo evaluations).
effective_dosage: Not specified (films with varying polymer blends and 40% PEG 400 as plasticizer).
study_duration: Not specified (time-kill studies mentioned but duration not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore new antifungal strategies, including carboxymethyl chitosan, to overcome drug resistance in invasive fungal infections.
results_summary: The review highlights carboxymethyl chitosan as a potential new antifungal agent, suggesting it may help address drug resistance when combined with conventional antifungals. No specific efficacy data for chitosan alone is provided.
population_specificity: Immunocompromised patients with fungal infections (general review, not a specific study population).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the hemostatic efficacy of chitosan and Surgicel in patients with cirrhosis after tooth extraction and assess the clinical model for post-operative bleeding.
results_summary: Both chitosan (Celox) and Surgicel were equally effective in controlling bleeding after tooth extraction in cirrhotic patients, with no statistically significant differences between groups and no reported side effects.
population_specificity: Fifty patients with cirrhosis undergoing tooth extraction under local anesthesia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the use of chitosan, among other natural polymers, in fabricating nanofibrous scaffolds for bone tissue regeneration.
results_summary: The study highlighted chitosan's potential in bone tissue engineering, emphasizing its tunable properties, ability to mimic natural extracellular matrix, and compatibility with additives like hydroxyapatite and growth factors to enhance bone regeneration.
population_specificity: Not specified (focused on in vitro or preclinical applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the effectiveness of chitosan and its derivatives in biosorption for heavy metal remediation from wastewater, with a focus on electrostatic interactions and binding mechanisms.
results_summary: The study highlighted chitosan's cost-effectiveness, environmental friendliness, and biodegradability for heavy metal removal, emphasizing the role of electrostatic interactions in biosorption, which had been overlooked in prior literature.
population_specificity: Not specified (focus on wastewater treatment applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the gelation mechanism, modifications, bioactive additives, and applications of Chitosan/GP hydrogels in treating bone defects.
results_summary: The study found that Chitosan/GP hydrogels mimic native extracellular matrix, provide a favorable microenvironment for cell growth, and offer potential for rapid recovery of bone defects without surgical intervention.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of applications in bone tissue engineering).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of chitosan-based in situ gelling systems for ophthalmic applications, focusing on gel formation mechanisms and therapeutic benefits.
results_summary: Chitosan demonstrates biocompatibility, mucoadhesive properties, and enhanced therapeutic effects when combined with stimuli-responsive polymers, improving ocular drug delivery and contact time. The review highlights its antibacterial, antifungal, and corneal wound-healing properties.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article, not a clinical study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the cytocompatibility, biocompatibility, and effectiveness of a thermosensitive chitosan-based hydrogel (HBC) for intracanalicular injection in obstructing the lacrimal drainage system.
results_summary: The study found minimal cytotoxicity in human corneal epithelial cells, significant improvement in tear secretion in a rabbit model, and enhanced clinical indicators like OSDI and tear break-up time in human trials. The hydrogel effectively reduced flow flux, demonstrating suitability as a liquid plug for tear flow blockage.
population_specificity: Primary human corneal epithelial cells (HCEpiCs), rabbit model, and human pilot study participants.
study_duration: Up to 72 hours for cytotoxicity assessment; duration in animal and human studies not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare Chitosan-Collagen among other biomaterials for developing tracheal epithelial grafts with mucociliary function.
results_summary: Chitosan-Collagen was evaluated for mechanical strength, cell attachment, spreading, metabolic activity, and differentiation, but specific performance metrics were not highlighted in the abstract. The composite biomaterial (SF-CVM) outperformed individual materials in ciliation and goblet cell differentiation.
population_specificity: In vitro study (no human or animal population specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize recent studies on sustained ocular drug/gene delivery, focusing on nanocarriers made by biodegradable polymers like chitosan, and their therapeutic applications in ocular diseases.
results_summary: The study highlighted that chitosan-based nanocarriers enhance therapeutic effects by improving tissue adherence, prolonging drug action, increasing bioavailability, reducing toxicity, and enabling targeted delivery in ocular tissues. It also discussed the bio-distribution of these nanocarriers and their applications in various ocular diseases.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on ocular drug delivery applications)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to provide a comprehensive overview of chitosan's emerging applications in medicine, tissue engineering, drug delivery, and other biomedical fields.
results_summary: The study highlights chitosan's unique biocompatibility, biodegradability, and non-toxicity, making it suitable for various biomedical applications, including regenerative medicine and therapeutic methods. It also discusses chitosan's promising roles in drug delivery, gene therapy, and cancer therapy.
population_specificity: Not specified (broad biomedical applications)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the potential of micro or nano delivery materials, including Chitosan, in improving antibiotic efficacy and targeting virulent factors in antibiotic-resistant pathogens.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings about Chitosan's effects but highlights the general potential of delivery materials to enhance antibiotic effectiveness and minimize resistance.
population_specificity: Not specified (focus is on antibiotic-resistant pathogenic organisms broadly).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent advances in polysaccharide-based nanoparticles, including chitosan, for oral insulin delivery to overcome gastrointestinal barriers.
results_summary: The study highlights chitosan-based nanoparticles as effective for protecting insulin from degradation and enhancing mucus permeation and transepithelial transport for oral administration.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate chitosan's potential as a bone scaffold material for bone regeneration, comparing its efficacy and benefits to autologous bone grafts.
results_summary: Chitosan demonstrated efficacy in bone regeneration due to its biodegradability, lack of immunogenicity, and physiological compatibility. When combined with growth factors or other scaffold materials, it proved to be a viable alternative to autologous bone grafts and also showed potential as a local drug delivery system.
population_specificity: Not specified (general bone reconstruction cases, including injury, nonunion, cancer resection, or idiopathic bone loss).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the performance of chitosan (CS) coatings on biodegradable Mg alloys in terms of corrosion resistance and biocompatibility.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan coatings, along with other polymeric coatings, improve the corrosion resistance and biocompatibility of Mg alloys, making them more suitable for biomedical applications. Functionalized polymer coatings, including chitosan, show promise due to their degradation compatibility, self-healing, drug-delivery, and osteoinduction properties.
population_specificity: Not specified (focused on material properties rather than human subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop quercetin-loaded chitosan nanoparticles (QCT-CS NPs) to enhance encapsulation efficiency and achieve sustained release for improved cancer therapy.
results_summary: The study found that QCT-CS NPs had high encapsulation efficiency (79.78%) and demonstrated sustained drug release (67.28% over 12 hours). In vitro and in vivo tests showed significantly reduced tumor volume and increased antioxidant enzyme levels compared to free quercetin.
population_specificity: Tumor xenograft mice with A549 and MDA MB 468 cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the properties of chitosan-alginate polyelectrolyte complex films for local periodontal therapy, focusing on adhesiveness, drug release, and structural characteristics.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan molecular weight and alginate concentration influenced film adhesiveness and drug release kinetics, with optimal results achieved using low molecular weight chitosan and higher alginate concentrations. The films exhibited delayed release, high swelling ability, and adhesiveness, fitting an anomalous transport mechanism.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of chitosan-PsaA nanoparticles in treating otitis media, particularly focusing on transdermal and intranasal drug delivery methods.
results_summary: Chitosan-PsaA nanoparticles showed promising results in experimental animal models of OM, demonstrating efficacy against biofilms and sustained drug delivery. New treatment modalities, including chitosan-based systems, could improve drug concentration in the middle ear and reduce treatment frequency.
population_specificity: Experimental animal models (not specified if human trials were included).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the antiviral properties of marine-derived glycans, including Chitosan, and their potential as novel therapeutic agents.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that marine-sourced glycans, including Chitosan, exhibit antiviral activity against a broad range of viruses, with many sulfated glycans showing notable efficacy. However, specific results for Chitosan alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing literature on marine organisms).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify the most promising therapies, including Chitosan, for preventing or treating fracture non-union through a systematic review and meta-analysis of preclinical studies.
results_summary: Chitosan was the most commonly tested therapy among the 204 evaluated, appearing in 6 studies, but methodological variability and poor reporting precluded meta-analysis to determine its efficacy conclusively.
population_specificity: Preclinical animal models (specific species not detailed in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review chitosan-based self-healing hydrogels, focusing on their preparation and bioapplications in cell therapy, tumor therapy, and wound healing.
results_summary: The study highlighted chitosan-based self-healing hydrogels constructed via dynamic imine bonds, noting their simple preparation, biocompatibility, and reparability under physiological conditions, with applications in therapeutic areas.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing studies)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the adjuvant potential of polysaccharides, including chitosan-based nanoparticles, in enhancing immune responses for vaccine development.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan-based nanoparticles and other polysaccharides exhibit strong immune-promoting effects, enhancing humoral, cellular, and mucosal immunities, and are biocompatible with low toxicity.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of polysaccharide adjuvants).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of chitosan-coated mesoporous silica nanoparticles (MSN) for improving oral insulin delivery by enhancing intestinal mucus interaction and retention time.
results_summary: The study suggests that chitosan-coated MSN can protect insulin from degradation, improve intestinal permeability, and enhance retention time, potentially enabling more effective oral insulin delivery.
population_specificity: Not specified (theoretical or preclinical study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the use of chitosan/alginate-based polymeric hydrogel devices for intravitreal drug delivery in treating posterior segment diseases like age-related macular degeneration.
results_summary: The abstract mentions chitosan/alginate as one of the polymeric components in intravitreal drug delivery systems but does not provide specific results or effects related to chitosan alone.
population_specificity: Not specified (focus is on polymeric devices for posterior segment diseases).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether adding a chitosan nerve tube to standard microsurgical nerve repair improves sensory recovery in patients with peripheral sensory nerve injuries.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan nerve tubes significantly improved tactile gnosis (measured by two-point discrimination) and sensitivity (measured by Semmes-Weinstein testing) compared to standard repair alone. Additionally, no neuromas developed in the intervention group, while three were found in the control group.
population_specificity: Patients with acute hand trauma requiring peripheral sensory nerve repair.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the preparation methods, analytical techniques, and biological functions of Chitooligosaccharide (COS) to provide an overall understanding of its applications.
results_summary: The study found that COS has strong biological functions, including anti-inflammatory, antitumor, immunomodulatory, and neuroprotective effects, along with excellent properties like biodegradability, biocompatibility, and non-toxicity. It also highlighted COS's better solubility compared to chitin and chitosan.
population_specificity: Not specified (general applications across fields like food, agriculture, pharmacy, etc.).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of chitosan-coated anionic liposomes in liquid versus dry-powder formulations for nose-to-brain delivery of ghrelin to manage cachexia.
results_summary: The powder formulation demonstrated superior mucoadhesion, ghrelin entrapment efficiency, enzymatic protection, and storage stability compared to the liquid formulation. It also showed effective aerosol generation and deposition in the olfactory zone of a nasal cast.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro and ex vivo models used).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine how chitosan-coated calcium phosphate nanoparticles modulate inflammatory pathways in microcrystal-induced arthritis, including gout, pseudogout, and BCP-induced arthritis.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan-coated nanoparticles inhibited pro-inflammatory mediators and proteolytic enzymes, reduced uric acid levels, and decreased crystal formation and tissue damage in in vitro and in vivo models of gout.
population_specificity: In vitro and in vivo models of microcrystal-induced arthritis (gout, pseudogout, BCP-induced arthritis).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the design and application of chitosan-based nanoplatforms for biomedical and pharmaceutical applications, particularly in drug/gene delivery, tissue engineering, and cancer therapy.
results_summary: The study highlights chitosan's unique properties (biocompatibility, biodegradability, bioactivity) and its versatility in creating multifunctional nanosystems for targeted diagnosis and therapy, with minimal systemic toxicity and maximal cytotoxicity against cancer cells.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether chitosan-functionalized nanoparticles could serve as an effective mucoadhesive drug delivery system for intestinal photodynamic therapy.
results_summary: Chitosan-modified nanoparticles exhibited mucoadhesive properties, but PEG-modified nanoparticles were found to be superior for overcoming the intestinal mucus barrier and delivering the photosensitizer to target cells.
population_specificity: In vitro studies using biosimilar mucus and mucus-covered Caco-2 cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of chitosan as a biomaterial for constructing neural scaffolds in tissue-engineered nerve grafts for peripheral nerve injury treatment.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan, among other natural and synthetic materials, is commonly used to build neural scaffolds, which, when combined with supporting cells or neurotrophic factors, can improve functional recovery in peripheral nerve injuries. Preliminary clinical applications of these scaffolds show satisfactory outcomes.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on peripheral nerve injury treatment)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review chitosan's properties and its role in tissue engineering, including its modifications and scaffold fabrication.
results_summary: The abstract highlights chitosan's versatility as a biopolymer for tissue engineering, emphasizing its modifiable properties to create tailored scaffolds. It suggests chitosan, whether virgin or modified, is promising for 2D and 3D scaffold applications.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research)

study_goal: To determine if combining isosorbide dinitrate spray and chitosan gel (10%) improves diabetic foot ulcer management compared to individual treatments or placebo.
results_summary: Chitosan gel alone showed a wound closure percentage of 58 ± 30, lower than the combination (71 ± 30) and isosorbide dinitrate (70 ± 27), but better than placebo (50 ± 16). Complete ulcer closure occurred in three patients with chitosan, fewer than the combination (six) but more than placebo (one).
population_specificity: 68 patients with diabetic foot ulcers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight the physicochemical and biological significance of chitooligosaccharide/chitosan oligosaccharide (COS) and propose further chemical analysis of thermally treated COS.
results_summary: The study emphasized COS's biocompatibility, mucoadhesiveness, and non-toxicity, along with its multiple biological activities and promising biomedical applications. However, challenges like viscosity and instability were noted, and the need for thermal degradation product analysis was suggested.
population_specificity: Not specified (general biomedical and pharmaceutical applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the properties and applications of chitosan-based hydrogels, including their biocompatibility, drug delivery efficiency, and potential in tissue engineering and water treatment.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan-based hydrogels exhibit valuable characteristics such as biocompatibility, nontoxicity, and biodegradability, making them suitable for biomedical and environmental applications. Additionally, chitosan nanocomposites demonstrated superior efficiency in controlled drug delivery, particularly for anticancer drugs like chlorambucil, compared to other polymeric systems.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro and computational analysis).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to discuss the applications of microneedles, including those made from chitosan, in drug delivery, biomarker determination, and dermatological treatments.
results_summary: The abstract mentions chitosan as one of the materials used in microneedle manufacturing but does not provide specific findings about its effects.
population_specificity: Not specified

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of chitosan, among other methods, in mitigating acrylamide concentration in fried food products.
results_summary: The study found that low-temperature air frying with chitosan was effective in reducing acrylamide concentration in fried food products, alongside other mitigation techniques like additives and asparaginase pre-treatment.
population_specificity: Not specified (general food products, not human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of chitosan supplementation on serum lipids in humans through a pooled analysis with trial sequential analysis.
results_summary: Chitosan supplementation significantly improved total cholesterol (TC) and low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) concentrations in all patients, with weighted mean differences of -0.20 mmol/L for TC and -0.17 mmol/L for LDL-C. The study concluded that chitosan is effective for therapeutic lipid management.
population_specificity: 1108 participants across 14 trials (21 treatment arms).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the role of biomaterials like chitosan in wound healing and repair, alongside growth factors and stem cells.
results_summary: The abstract indicates that chitosan has been proven effective in wound healing, though specific efficacy metrics are not detailed. It is grouped with other biomaterials and therapies showing positive effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on wound healing applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of chitosan and MTAD for smear layer removal from root canals using scanning electron microscopy.
results_summary: Chitosan was more effective than MTAD in removing the smear layer, particularly in the apical third of the root canal, with statistically significant results. No significant difference was found in the coronal and middle regions between chitosan and MTAD. The saline control group showed the lowest efficacy in all regions.
population_specificity: Thirty single-canal premolars (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the literature on electrospinning chitosan and its composite formulations for tissue engineering applications.
results_summary: The review found evidence supporting the favorable properties and biocompatibility of chitosan electrospun composite biomaterials for tissue regeneration, though further in vivo studies are needed for clinical translation.
population_specificity: Not specified (literature review)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the mechanisms by which chitosan lowers serum LDL cholesterol concentrations by measuring surrogate markers of cholesterol absorption, synthesis, and degradation.
results_summary: Chitosan treatment significantly reduced serum LDL cholesterol levels in obese subjects over 12 weeks, with changes in surrogate markers indicating altered cholesterol metabolism.
population_specificity: 116 obese subjects (BMI 31.7, range 28.1-38.9 kg/m²)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of divalent metal phosphates (including magnesium, strontium, and zinc) in chitosan scaffolds on osteogenic differentiation of stem cells from human exfoliated deciduous teeth (SHEDs).
results_summary: SHEDs cultured in chitosan scaffolds with divalent metal phosphates showed significantly increased osteoblastic differentiation, evidenced by higher alkaline phosphatase activity, bone-related gene expression, and mineral deposition, particularly with magnesium and zinc phosphates.
population_specificity: Stem cells from human exfoliated deciduous teeth (SHEDs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the loading efficiency of chitosan-based polymersomes with fluorescent contrast substances and their controlled release into cells via chemical modifications and electroporation.
results_summary: The study found that quantum dots (QDs) were tightly retained in the chitosan polymer matrix, while organic fluorophores like FITC-dextran showed variable release rates, suggesting QD-labeled polymersomes are effective fluorescent probes and nano-drug delivery systems.
population_specificity: HeLa cells (in vitro)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of chitosan administration on systolic and diastolic blood pressure through a pooled analysis of randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: Chitosan consumption significantly decreased diastolic blood pressure at higher dosages and in shorter-term interventions but had no significant effect on systolic blood pressure. The results should be interpreted cautiously due to the limited number of eligible RCTs included.
population_specificity: 617 participants from eight randomized controlled trials (human studies).
effective_dosage: Higher dosage (specific amount not stated in the abstract).
study_duration: Shorter-term interventions (specific duration not stated in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether oligosaccharides derived from cress seed mucilage could protect against chromium(VI)-induced oxidative stress and liver damage in mice.
results_summary: The study found that chromium(VI) induced significant oxidative stress, liver damage, and apoptosis in mice, but oligosaccharide treatment effectively mitigated these effects by reducing oxidative stress markers, improving liver function, and reversing histopathological changes.
population_specificity: Albino mice
effective_dosage: 200 µg/mL (in vitro); dosage for in vivo study not specified

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of sodium nitroprusside (SNP) on rice seedlings exposed to chromium (Cr) and low-temperature stress, focusing on oxidative damage and plant resilience.
results_summary: Chromium exposure caused severe oxidative damage, increased reactive oxygen species (ROS), and reduced chlorophyll and photosynthesis. SNP application mitigated Cr toxicity by reducing ROS, lipid peroxidation, and Cr uptake while improving plant growth and photosynthetic efficiency.
population_specificity: Rice seedlings (Oryza sativa)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the coating integrity and corrosion protection of trimethylsilane (TMS) plasma nanocoatings on cobalt chromium (CoCr) L605 cardiovascular stents.
results_summary: The TMS plasma nanocoatings significantly improved corrosion resistance, reduced metal ion release, and showed no signs of pitting or corrosion, with corrosion rates approximately half an order of magnitude lower than uncoated stents.
population_specificity: Cobalt chromium (CoCr) L605 cardiovascular stents.
